data.title: GamepadState.Thumbsticks
data.body:
Hi,

I was having problems with reading the thumbstick input, it was always zero, it turns out that GamePade.GetState() was returning an empty GamePadState (It probably should have thrown Not Implemented Exception).

I have added thumbstick data into the new GamePadState that is returned.

Triggers and Buttons still need to be added. I cannot find triggers so I will leave that. I will look over buttons later.

data.title: Adds submodules for Samples and Tests
data.body:
MonoGame.Tests has been removed, in favor of a submodule, Tests.  The MonoGame-Samples project has been added as a submodule, Samples.

And a very small fix to Game.cs to make the automated tests work correctly.

data.title: Develop: GlStateManager bug fix.
data.body:
Merge GLStateManager.World and View into WorldView, since GL needs it so

 GL11.MatrixMode(All11.Viewport); is not a valid GL Command!

Also, ToFloatArray is not necessary. I saw the proper use of ref somewhere else in the code. I threw that in too. One less allocation.

data.title: Adds a testing harness and a few XNA conformance tests.
data.body:
On Windows, the Tests solution contains a version of the tests which can be run against XNA as well as a version that can be run against MonoGame.  These are standard NUnit test assemblies, and should be run as normal with NUnit.

For Mac and Linux, the state of NUnit is trickier.  Mono/MonoDevelop ship with quite an old version, so a custom runner is used.  So, rather than using NUnit or MonoDevelop's built-in runner, a custom runner is provided that executes the tests using the version of NUnit in ThirdParty/Libs.  After the tests have completed, the default browser is invoked to view the HTML version of the results.

It would be straightforward to add support for the custom runner on Windows, if anyone wants it.
### GameTest
- Collects various tests that make assertions about the contract of the
  Game class in XNA vs the current contract in MonoGame.
### GameTest+Properties
- Makes assertions about the Game class's properties.
- Tests for default values, read-only or read-write status, availability
  during the lifetime of the Game, etc.
### CommandLineInterface
- Wraps the core logic for invoking NUnit into an opaque wrapper that
  can be easily invoked from different platforms.
- Currently writes NUnit results in an abbreviated format to stdout, the
  standard NUnit xml format as test_results.xml, and an xsl-transformed
  test_results.html for easy viewing.
### Game
- Added InactiveSleepTime as a to-be-implemented property.
### MonoGame.Tests/Resources
- Houses the xsl used by CommandLineInterface, as well as sample data
  and a Makefile for easy development (well, easy on Mac, anyway).

data.title: Adds ThirdParty/Libs as a git submodule
data.body:
This makes OpenTK, NUnit and Moq available as a git submodule, so that they can be easily pulled by contributors using:

```
git submodule init   # just the first time
git submodule update # the first time and on subsequent updates
```

The Windows and Linux projects now both reference OpenTK in this way, to avoid forcing devs to manually set this libraries up (in the GAC on Windows and by modifying the csproj on Linux).  This also makes way for the soon-to-exist conformance tests.

Currenly the submodule references [kungfubanana/MonoGame-Dependencies](https://github.com/kungfubanana/MonoGame-Dependencies).  This repo should be cloned into the mono account and the git submodule definition (in .gitmodules) updated accordingly.

_Note that I've deleted the IsContentLost property from VertexBuffer.  It's my understanding that this will be deleted eventually, and it was preventing me from doing compile tests_

data.title: Networking fixes and Game Logging
data.body:
Fixed a couple of networking issues. the first is the LocalGamer array being empty when trying to send a profile. The second is the Gamers in the AllGamers array having different indexes on each machine which results in the Respawn in netrumble spawning the wrong player.

Added an internal Instance static property for the Game class to aide with Logging .
Added a windows implementation of the Log method to write to Console.
